intro: Muraltia langebergensis, commonly known as the Langeberg mallow, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring. It has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Muraltia langebergensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
